title.rendered: “Unmasking IDF’s Intense 24-Hour Campaign: Over 400 Terror Targets Neutralized in Gaza Strip”

content.rendered:
IDF Spokesperson:

The IDF continues to strike in the Gaza Strip – in the past day, over 400 targets have been attacked; dozens of targets were attacked in the Khan Younis area.

The IDF attacked over 400 terror targets across the Gaza Strip in the last day.

During the night, Air Force fighter planes attacked over 50 targets in a widespread strike in the Khan Younis area.

Fighters from Combat Squad 551 eliminated terrorists and the infrastructure of the Hamas terror organization in the Beit Lahia area by tank fire and by directing aircraft to attack from the air.

The 215 Fire Brigade activated artillery fire and directed aerial strikes in the northern strip. Among the strikes directed by the brigade, a terrorist cell ambushing our forces and a mosque that served the Izz ad-Din al-Qassam Brigades as an operational command post by a fighter plane.

Fighters from Brigade 261 (Training Base 1) directed aircraft to attacks and destroyed targets from the air and from the ground. Among the targets – an arms depot, and terror infrastructure used for the enemy’s renewed preparations.

Also, during the night, the Naval Arm forces conducted a focused operational activity in the south of the Gaza Strip, in the Khan Younis area and in Dir al-Balah, during which they attacked by precision shooting military targets of the Hamas terror organization, as well as infrastructure and equipment used by the organization’s naval force.

Fighters from Combat Squad 401, in cooperation with the brigade’s fire complex, eliminated terrorist cells and directed fire against terror targets in the northern strip.

Attached is documentation of terrorist attacks by the fire complex of Brigade 401 in the western Jabalia area: https://bit.ly/47ZyRDL

Attached is documentation of IDF attacks in the Strip: https://bit.ly/3T2b4Pm

Attached is documentation of IDF forces’ activity in the Gaza Strip: https://bit.ly/3RqDMZ9

Attached are images on the topic: https://IDFANC.activetrail.biz/ANC02122023.784512313
